alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monroe and southwestern Wayne Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Maybee, or near Carleton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Carleton around 320 PM EDT. Belleville around 340 PM EDT. Romulus and Flat Rock around 400 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Scofield, New Boston, Sumpter Township, Oakville, Willow and Waltz. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
